$META, $GOOGL, $MSFT & $AMZN are racing to own the AI infrastructure layer because whoever owns the compute owns the toll booth of the next digital economy.

Build the platform first then let the ecosystem build on top and capture margin on every workload that runs through your stack.

$AMD partners with one of India‚Äôs largest IT services firms Tata Consultancy to deploy Helios rack-scale AI infrastructure.

This is AMD moving up the stack into full-system AI platforms to compete with $NVDA DGX/HGX model for customers who want an alternative to CUDA lock-in.

PETER LYNCH‚ÄôS FAVORITE METRIC IS THE PEG RATIO

PEG < 1 usually means mispriced growth
PEG > 2 starts to push into the danger zone

Peter Lynch favored the PEG ratio because it ties valuation to growth.

I prefer using it over a 2026‚Äì2028 window so valuation adjusts for how fast the business is actually compounding.

For example, $AMD may trade at ~31x forward earnings but EPS is expected to grow from $4.46 in 2026 to $11.80 in 2028 implying ~63% earnings CAGR so their PEG is ~0.5.

HOW $NVDA BUILT AN AI MONOPOLY

‚Ä¢ Hardware: GPUs (Hopper, Blackwell, Rubin roadmap)
‚Ä¢ Software: CUDA, TensorRT, Triton, NeMo, Omniverse
‚Ä¢ Networking: InfiniBand, NVLink, Spectrum-X
‚Ä¢ Systems: DGX, HGX, complete rack-scale solutions

Nvidia didn't win because they had the best chip but won because Jensen built CUDA in 2006, bought Mellanox before networking mattered, locked up $TSM advanced packaging & was ready when ChatGPT made AI infrastructure the most important market in tech.
By 2028, $NVDA could be generating over $1B in revenue per day  ü§Ø

Fibonacci levels help you see where momentum pauses by mapping potential areas of support & resistance using ratios from the Fib sequence.  

I find them useful because strong trends often consolidate at these levels before continuing higher & this list reflects names consolidating between the 0.382  & 0.618 extension levels.

Former $GOOGL CEO Eric Schmidt says ‚Äúwe‚Äôre running out of electricity‚Äù noting  U.S. needs ~92 GW of new power versus ~1.5 GW per nuclear plant which frames the scale of the problem.

The real bottleneck for AI is power and hyperscalers are now racing for GW-scale energy.

Now running at an ~$85B revenue run-rate and still growing ~23% YoY.
